intro: Seseli djianeae, commonly known as the Djiane's sesame, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climates. Its seeds are encased in a hairy, spherical fruit, which aids in wind dispersal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
